![\(From L to R\) Sam Lavigne, Tega Brain, and Ra√∫l de Nieves](https://cdn.sanity.io/images/vgvol637/production/27c97dc5e87a50539dec381a43d6a347c96bb9d0-2000x1125.png?w=2000)
(From L to R) Sam Lavigne, Tega Brain, and Ra√∫l de Nieves
# Opening Reception for Ra√∫l de Nieves, Tega Brain, and Sam Lavigne
Friday, Sep 12, 2025
7‚Äì9pm
[Free with RSVP](https://www.eventbrite.com/e/1497691338109)
Join Pioneer Works in a public opening celebration of **Ra√∫l de Nieves:_In Light of Innocence_ **and **Tega Brain & Sam Lavigne: _How To Get To Zero_**.
_In Light of Innocence_ marks Ra√∫l de Nieves‚Äôs first solo institutional show in New York City, featuring a new body of work that transforms the entire Main Hall of Pioneer Works into an immersive, cathedral-like environment that conjures personal reflection and collective imagination. Known for his use of modest, everyday materials, de Nieves explores aesthetic beauty while challenging its historical and religious underpinnings. His practice references Western religious traditions‚Äîparticularly, those of Catholicism‚Äîand ultimately reimagine places of worship as sites of transformation, despite their legacies of violence and exclusion. The exhibition presents the site-specific installation of 50 faux stained glass panels, all further inspired by the visual language of tarot.
_How To Get To Zero_ marks the first-ever survey of work by residency alumni Tega Brain and Sam Lavigne. The exhibition presents a comprehensive look at the artists‚Äô solo and collaborative practices, which examine the present limits and future possibilities of political agency during our time of climate crisis. Over the past ten years, Brain and Lavigne have worked at the forefront of social critique and participatory art, examining subjects ranging from economic corruption to police surveillance, and from data manipulation to the commodification of everyday life. By repurposing the technologies used to perpetuate these conditions, the artists highlight the underlying conceptual and political frameworks that so often reinforce an unjust and repressive status quo.
####  _Ra√∫l de Nieves:_ In Light of Innocence _is made possible with generous support by Bruce M. Halpryn and Chas Riebe with additional support provided by 1800 Tequila, public funds from the New York City Department of Cultural Affairs in partnership with the City Council, as well as the New York State Council on the Arts with the support of the Office of the Governor and the New York State Legislature._
####  _Tega Brain & Sam Lavigne: _How To Get To Zero _is made possible with support from Creative Capital. Exhibitions at Pioneer Works are supported, in part, by public funds from the New York City Department of Cultural Affairs in partnership with the City Council, and the New York State Council on the Arts with the support of the Office of the Governor and the New York State Legislature._

# Second Sundays: September 2025
Sunday, Sep 14, 2025
12‚Äì6pm
Free RSVP
Donate
Since 2013, Pioneer Works has hosted Second Sundays, a free monthly open house. Highlighting our programs, artists-in-residence, and Red Hook community members, Second Sundays features open studios, exhibitions, workshops, live music, and food‚Äîwith programming across all three floors and in our garden.
Food and drink by Maya Taqueria, La Newyorkina, and Pioneer Works Bar.
Second Sundays is funded in part by a grant from the New York City Tourism Foundation. Pioneer Works is supported in part by public funds from the New York City Department of Cultural Affairs in partnership with the City Council and the New York State Council on the Arts with the support of the Office of the Governor and the New York State Legislature.
####  _This program takes place within artist Ra√∫l de Nieves‚Äôs site-specific installation,_ In Light of Innocence _. Learn more about the exhibition[here](https://pioneerworks.org/exhibitions/raul-de-nieves-in-light-of-innocence)._

#### [Tega Brain & Sam Lavigne: How To Get To Zero](https://pioneerworks.org/exhibitions/tega-sam-exhibition)
# Open Studios
[Matt Bruinooge](https://pioneerworks.org/residency/matt-bruinooge)[Peggy Chiang](https://pioneerworks.org/residency/peggy-chiang)[Biraaj Dodiya](https://pioneerworks.org/residency/biraaj-dodiya)[Cameron Granger](https://pioneerworks.org/residency/cameron-granger)[Tommy Kha](https://pioneerworks.org/residency/tommy-kha)[Alison Nguyen](https://pioneerworks.org/residency/alison-nguyen)[Samora Pinderhughes](https://pioneerworks.org/residency/samora-pinderhughes)[Leah Victoria](https://pioneerworks.org/residency/leah-victoria)
Title
Time
#### Exhibition Scavenger Hunt 
All Day
Location: 2nd Floor Gallery, 3rd Floor Gallery, Main Hall
Grab a scavenger hunt sheet from the North Hall and enjoy an in-depth exploration of our current exhibitions, Ra√∫l de Nieves: _In Light of Innocence_ and Sam Lavigne and Tega Brain: _How to Get to Zero_. Once you‚Äôve completed the hunt, return your sheet and claim your prize!
#### Pioneer Works Youth Program Gallery
All Day
Location: Classroom
Come see the culminating showcase from our summer youth programs‚Äîfrom the digital art of our Ideas in Animation class to the inventive sounds of the Pioneer Works Music Program.
We‚Äôre proud to partner with **Red Hook Art Project** and the **Joseph Miccio Community Center** , and our amazing educators included former PW Alumni Residents Robin Pak, Marni Pagter, Ryan Easter, Luke Stewart, Amirtha Kidambi, Shara Lunon, Chris Williams, and Lester St. Louis!
#### Freedom School Documentary Film Screening
All Day
Location: Conference Room, Science Studios
The teenaged students from the **Freedom School Documentary** program will share their collaborative film,**_SAME CITY, DIFFERENT HOOKS_** , which they made entirely themselves in our documentary intensive. Confronting the realities of our neighborhood‚Äôs housing crisis, the short focuses on their experiences of change in the Red Hook community. This program is presented in partnership with **Red Hook Initiative** , and facilitated by educators M√≥nica Torres and Victorious De Costa.
  

#### Little Free Library
ALL DAY
Location: Garden
The **Brooklyn Book Bodega** and **Little Free Library** debuts a library in collaboration with Pioneer Works. With children‚Äôs books and novels in both English and Spanish, stop by and pick out a free new read throughout the day.
#### Hot House Pop-Up with Lower East Side Cactus & Succulent Society
12-4 pm 
Location: Garden
The **Lower East Side Cactus & Succulent Society** bring a special plant sale featuring a variety of heat-loving species. Browse and shop unique cacti and succulents‚Äîand chat about cochineals, cyanotypes, and other creative ways to work with the power of the sun.
#### RETI Center Community Solar (Local Power) Demo Table
12‚Äì4 pm
Location: Garden
Explore **RETI Center‚Äô** s _Local Power_ Community Solar initiative, which provides three pathways to strengthen Brooklyn communities through sustainability and resilience. Visitors can learn how to pre-register and subscribe to neighborhood-scale solar (without installing panels at home), how building owners can host solar projects at no cost, and how job seekers‚Äîparticularly from low- and moderate-income communities‚Äîcan apply for fully funded solar training and paid internships.
  

#### Climate Modeling in Action 
12-4 pm
Location: Science Studios
Explore how **NASA‚Äôs Goddard Institute of Space Studies** uses models to study climate change and communicates its impacts, with a special focus on how extreme heat affects human health.
#### The Metropolitan Opera at Second Sundays: Comic Creation Workshop
12:30-3:30 pm
Location: Classroom
In concert with the **_The Amazing Adventures of Kavalier & Clay_**, the MetOpera has invited illustrator and pop culture writer **Joshua Edelglass** to lead a drop-in workshop for kids and families exploring the fundamentals of comic creation‚Äîfrom coloring and costume design to text and worldbuilding.
#### The Metropolitan Opera at Second Sundays: The Amazing Adventures of Kavalier & Clay
1-2 PM
Location: Main Hall
Join video art director **Nicol Scott** and comic book expert **Chip Kidd** in conversation about the history of the genre, the use of projection in live art, and superhero animation comes to life in the opera **_The Amazing Adventures of Kavalier & Clay_**, based on the book by Michael Chabon. **Dr. Miriam Mora** will moderate the discussion, and musical moments from the opera will be performed. Learn more [here.](https://www.metopera.org/season/2025-26-season/the-amazing-adventures-of-kavalier--clay/)
#### Solargazing with the Amateur Astronomers Association
1‚Äì4 pm
Location: Garden
Weather permitting, join the **Amateur Astronomers Association** in the garden for safe solar viewing and a closer look at the very star that fuels our planet's heat. Telescopes equipped with special filters will be provided. Catch a special glimpse at the Sun's surface features‚Äîsunspots, flares, and all.
#### Melting Metropolis Pop-Up
2‚Äì4pm
Location: Science Studios
Explore the sensory, cultural, and historical textures of urban summer with [_Melting Metropolis_](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https://www.meltingmetropolis.com/__;!!E8lrGBvW!u3VbalMg1jN9CiF-07lezGhnPxNlFIEliR_GA1wGS8EfdgMLw7-O_AP4xgQIo6p9KxzhPOgM9pcUkEU6E5TDjmiZmMxxH_lR$), a project exploring how New Yorkers (alongside Londoners and Parisians) have lived with, mitigated, and even embraced heat since 1945.
Join us in wandering through archival images and oral histories‚Äîand discover how city dwellers have navigated the joys, challenges, and health effects of sweltering summers. Plus, comb through your own family archives‚Äîand enter **Melting Metropolis** + [**Urban Archive**](https://www.urbanarchive.nyc/)'s [open call](https://www.urbanarchive.nyc/summer-in-the-city-2025) for personal histories of hot cities. It‚Äôll be the perfect warm-up to the upcoming Heat Week at Pioneer Works, which will include a special episode of _Science & Society bringing health to the heart of Climate Week 2025._
#### Broadcast Radio Hour 
3-4 pm
Location: Media Lab
Artists and PW Alumni**Sam Lavigne** and **Tega Brain** discuss political agency, the climate crisis, and their new Pioneer Works exhibition, _How to Get To Zero,_ with media theorist Shannon Mattern.
  

#### Music
4 PM
Location: Main Hall
**Eric Copeland** ‚Äîexperimental musician and founding member of **Black Dice** ‚Äîarrives at Pioneer Works for an electric live set in the Main Hall. Using a variety of instruments and effects, Copeland is most known for his work with vocal sounds, primitive sampling and looping techniques, and delay manipulation.

# Supper Club with Yara Herrera
Tuesday, Sep 16, 2025
6‚Äì10pm
**COCKTAIL HOUR**  
6PM
  

**DINNER**  
7PM
**Chef**
Yara Herrera
**Location**
Pioneer Works
159 Pioneer Street
Brooklyn, NY 11231
**$250 TICKET PRICE**
TICKETS ONLY AVAILABLE TO PW MEMBERS LEVEL $250 AND ABOVE
Buy Tickets
[Become a Member](https://pioneerworks.org/membership)
[Pioneer Works Supper Club](https://pioneerworks.org/series/supper-club) is a series of unique dining experiences that builds community around food and celebrates local chefs as culinary artists.
This edition of Supper Club features the renowned chef of Hellbender, **Yara Herrera**. Join us at Pioneer Works for a seated feast on Mexican Independence Day. The evening will draw inspiration from and celebrate Ra√∫l de Nieves' _In Light of Innocence_ , on view from September 12 to December 14.
**Supper Club tickets are available to Pioneer Works Members at the $250 level and above. To join, either emailmembers@pioneerworks.org or purchase a membership and ticket bundle via Eventbrite. **
Pioneer Works Members will receive an access code to purchase tickets via email.
****About the Chef****
Yara Herrera is the chef and partner of Hellbender, a Mexican-American restaurant in Queens, New York. Born and raised in Los Angeles as a first-generation Mexican-American, Yara launched her culinary journey at just 20 years old, honing her skills at esteemed establishments such as Wolfgang Puck‚Äôs Spago and Providence, a celebrated two-Michelin-starred sustainable seafood restaurant. In 2018, an invitation from David Chang to join the highly acclaimed Momofuku Ko brought her to New York City, where she would go on to join the team at Xilonen (the former sister restaurant from the Oxomoco team). At Hellbender, Yara is embarking on her first chef and owner venture, showcasing her distinctive approach to Mexican-American cuisine. Quickly established as a standout dining destination in the neighborhood, Hellbender was awarded one of  _Esquire_ ‚Äôs Best New Restaurants for 2024, and granted a two star review in  _The New York Times_. Yara's culinary journey is deeply rooted in the evolution of Mexican-American flavors, where she seamlessly blends tradition with innovation. Her efforts recently attracted attention from Star Chefs, where Yara was named one of their 2025 Rising Stars.  

****[Membership](https://pioneerworks.org/membership)**** helps sustain Pioneer Works' free admission model and keep our programming affordable and accessible to everybody. Your support upholds our mission while laying the foundation to sustain Pioneer Works for years to come.
####  _This program takes place within artist Ra√∫l de Nieves‚Äôs site-specific installation,_ In Light of Innocence _. Learn more about the exhibition_  _[here](https://pioneerworks.org/exhibitions/raul-de-nieves-in-light-of-innocence)._  
  
_Beverage sponsorship provided by 1800 Tequila and Acqua Panna / San Pellegrino._

# m√∫m
## with support from Mr. Silla
Friday, Sep 19, 2025
  

**Time**
Doors: 7pm
Start: 8pm
[Buy Tickets](https://www.eventbrite.com/e/mum-tickets-1360889821089)
Join us in the Main Hall for a rare live performance from exploratory Icelandic musical ensemble **m√∫m** with support from **Mr. Silla.**
Formed in 1997, the self-described 'conveyors of sound' are renowned for their ethereal blend of electronic and acoustic elements, crafting soundscapes that invite listeners into a world of delicate melodies and intricate textures. Over the years, m√∫m has collaborated with diverse artists, including Kylie Minogue and the Kronos Quartet, and has been celebrated for albums like _Yesterday Was Dramatic ‚Äì Today Is OK_ (1999) and _Smilewound_ (2013).  

**About the artists**
**m√∫m** (pronunciation: [muÀêm] - moom) is an exploratory Icelandic musical group whose music is characterized by experiments in electronic music, soft vocals, glitchy beats, innovative sampling, and eerie effects with a variety of traditional and unconventional instruments. The band was formed in 1997 by founding members Gunnar √ñrn Tynes, √ñrvar Sm√°rason, and twin sisters Gyda and Krist√≠n Anna Valtysd√≥tti. Since then, the collective has released six full-length albums, as well as a mountain of other music, singles, EP‚Äôs, collaborations, theatre, and film music. The band's lineup is in a state of constant change. So is their music.  

**Mr. Silla** , aka Sigurlaug G√≠slad√≥ttir, has been a fixture in the Icelandic music and art scene for decades. A member of m√∫m since 2007, their many collaborations include a host of domestic and international acts such as Mike Lindsay (Tunng), Snorri Helgason, Mice Parade, Low Roar and Sam Potter (Late of the Pier) to name a few. Multi-instrumentalist, writer, and producer, Sigurlaug has been active since 2005, recording two solo albums (Mr. Silla, Hands On Hands) to critical acclaim, captivating audiences with their evocative stage presence and arresting vocal stylings. Make sure to be blissfully aware of the upcoming album entitled _SANDS_ , the latest collaborative project of Mr. Silla & Sam Potter, set for release next year.
#### _Presented in collaboration with[Wordless Music](https://www.wordlessmusic.org/)._
####  _This program takes place within artist Ra√∫l de Nieves‚Äôs site-specific installation,_ In Light of Innocence _. Learn more about the exhibition[here](https://pioneerworks.org/exhibitions/raul-de-nieves-in-light-of-innocence)._

# Mindy Seu: A Sexual History of the Internet
Saturday, Sep 20, 2025
  

**Time**
Doors: 7pm
Start: 7:30pm
**General On Sale:**  
Wednesday, Aug 20 at 10 AM ET
[Get Tickets](https://www.eventbrite.com/e/1505175292819?aff=oddtdtcreator)
Pioneer Works presents a lecture performance and book launch for **Mindy Seu** ‚Äôs **_A SEXUAL HISTORY OF THE INTERNET_** , a reimagining of the digital tools shaping the most intimate aspects of our lives.
_A SEXUAL HISTORY OF THE INTERNET_ gathers anecdotes, artworks, and historical artifacts that reveal the pervasive and perverted origins of digital tools. In this interactive lecture, audience members will become a chorus of readers that recite lesser-known histories through a shared script on their mobile phones. Part history, part experiment in collective storytelling, the performance entangles sexuality and techno-development, innovation and autonomy, lust and extraction.
![photo of book, A Sexual History of the Internet, on black table.](https://cdn.sanity.io/images/vgvol637/production/48ad15231a6d683a5bcd1f06917b69a6ba2b55ac-2000x2510.jpg?w=1000)
A Sexual History of the Internet by Mindy Seu. Tom Hancocks
Alongside the lecture performance will be a 700+ page, eponymous artist book _A SEXUAL HISTORY OF THE INTERNET_. In keeping with the project‚Äôs commitment to redistribution, 30% of book profits will be shared among 45 contributors through a new model of attribution called Citational Splits on Metalabel. Books will be available for purchase, and a signing with Mindy Seu will follow the performance. Seating will be available on a first-come, first-served basis.
**Designer** : Laura Coombs  
**Collaborator** : Julio Correa  
**Editor** : Meg Miller  
**Illustrator** : Ven Qiu  
**Metalabel** : Yancey Strickler  

**Mindy Seu** (b. 1991, California) is an artist and technologist based in Los Angeles and New York City whose practice focuses on technology-driven performance and publication. _A SEXUAL HISTORY OF THE INTERNET_(2025) follows her first book _CYBERFEMINISM INDEX_ (2023), a pseudo-encyclopedia that gathers three decades of online activism and net art, which was commissioned by Rhizome, premiered at the New Museum, and awarded a Graham Foundation Grant. Seu is a former Tech Resident at Pioneer Works, and teaches at the University of California, Los Angeles, where she is an Associate Professor in the Department of Design Media Arts.
####  _This program takes place within artist Ra√∫l de Nieves‚Äôs site-specific installation,_ In Light of Innocence _. Learn more about the exhibition[here](https://pioneerworks.org/exhibitions/raul-de-nieves-in-light-of-innocence)._

_Pioneer Works and Wellcome co-present Heat Week including this special episode of Science & Society, bringing health to the heart of Climate Week NYC._
The Earth is hotter now than at any other point in human history. As fossil fuels burn and ecosystems are destroyed, heat is driving increasingly extreme weather‚Äîturbo-charging hurricanes, floods, fires, and droughts. By 2070, one-fifth of the planet could be as scorchingly hot as the (rapidly expanding) Sahara Desert, and up to 3.5 billion people may have to move as their homes become inhospitable.
Extreme heat is a public health threat that leads to school closures, workplace injuries, droughts, famine, mental health crises, and increased domestic violence. In the United States, heat stress is [the leading cause](https://www.weather.gov/hazstat/#&_intcmp=fxw_extreme-weather_article_main-content_article-body_2_3) of weather-related deaths‚Äîkilling more people than hurricanes, tornadoes, and floods combined. Those among us with the fewest resources are disproportionally affected‚Äîspecifically, people of color, low-income people, children, and the elderly.
Put simply, we now live in an entirely new climate era‚Äîone that is hotter and more unpredictable‚Äîand we are inadequately prepared for the unavoidable consequences. Heat-related illnesses and deaths are largely preventable with proper planning, education, and action. So, how do we make our homes, neighborhoods, and cities cooler? How do we design and build for the future, with heat adaptation and risk prevention in mind? How do we care for our vulnerable populations? How do we craft policies to advance climate solutions and human well-being?
For a conversation grappling with how we might adapt to and live in a warming world, **Dr. Ayana Elizabeth Johnson** will host journalist and writer**Jeff Goodell** and climate resilience expert **Jainey Bavishi** for _Science & Society: Heat Advisory_. **Brad Einstein** will offer a comedic introduction (with puppets).
Come early and stick around to explore further into the thoughts and questions surrounding heat and health with our guest specialists who will be roving, available to engage and offer insight: renowned climate modeler and Goddard Institute of Space Studies Director **Dr. Gavin Schmidt** , historian of urban and environmental history **Dr. Kara Schlichting** , and others to be included.
Before and after the conversation, **DJ Mamoudou** will bring the heat to the dancefloor. On the first floor, visuals will be on view by**[OceanX](https://oceanx.org/)**, a global nonprofit working to unlock the ocean's sustainable potential‚Äîto benefit both people and the planet. On the second floor, **The Climate Story Project** ‚Äîan initiative of [The New York Climate Exchange](https://nyclimateexchange.org)‚Äîinvites you to listen to personal, pre-recorded stories about climate change and to record your own. 10-minute time slots will be available throughout the evening. In the garden, stargazing with the **Amateur Astronomers‚Äô Association** will open and conclude the night, weather-permitting. All evening, **[For All Things Good](https://www.forallthingsgoodbk.com/) **will be serving up fresh Mexican food.
Our signature series [_Science & Society_](https://pioneerworks.org/series/science-and-society) grapples with our relationships with nature and each other. Each leads us deep into humanity‚Äôs timely and intersectional challenges, from biodiversity to plastics, public knowledge, the high seas, farming, climate, and love.
**About the Speakers**
**Jainey Bavishi** is a nationally recognized expert in climate resilience. She most recently served as Assistant Secretary of Commerce and Deputy Administrator of NOAA. Previously, she directed the NYC Mayor‚Äôs Office of Resiliency, advancing strategies to address extreme heat and coastal flooding. She has also held senior roles in the Obama administration and international and nonprofit settings.
**Jeff Goodell** ‚Äôs most recent book is the New York Times bestseller _The Heat Will Kill You First: Life and Death on a Scorched Planet_. It was named a Best Book of the Year by NPR, _The Economist_ , and the Los _Angeles Times._ It was also nominated for the LA Times Book Prize and the New York Public Library‚Äôs Helen Bernstein Book Award for Excellence in Journalism. Goodell is the author of six previous books. He has covered climate change for more than two decades at _Rolling Stone_.
**Dr. Ayana Elizabeth Johnson** is a marine biologist, policy expert, and writer. She is co-founder of the nonprofit think tank [Urban Ocean Lab](https://urbanoceanlab.org/), a distinguished scholar at Bowdoin College, and the author of The New York Times bestseller [_What If We Get it Right_?: _Visions of Climate Futures_](https://www.getitright.earth/). She is in love with climate solutions.
**Cultural Enhancement Personnel**
**DJ Mamoudou** (Mamoudou N'Diaye) is a Mauritanian/Malian-American comedian, TV/film writer, filmmaker, creative consultant, DJ, and former 7th-grade teacher. N'Diaye has been a correspondent for digital media companies, a creative comedy consultant for social justice nonprofits.
**Brad Einstein** is a comedian and writer, a two-time National Park Service Artist-In-Residence, a National Forest Service Voice of the Wilderness, and a "Brilliant Comedy Mastermind" according to some very kind exaggerators at Time Out New York. Originally from Pennsylvania and now based in LA, Brad's work focuses on comedy nature documentaries and climate communications.
**About Wellcome**
Wellcome is a global charitable foundation, based in the UK. Wellcome supports science to solve the urgent health challenges facing everyone. We support discovery research into life, health, and wellbeing, and we‚Äôre taking on three worldwide health challenges: mental health, infectious disease, and climate and health.
At Climate Week NYC, Wellcome is creating opportunities for people to explore what they think and feel about climate and health. In partnership with the creative and cultural sectors, we're sharing insights into science and health in ways that are meaningful and accessible to all.
#### _This program is co-presented with Wellcome and supported by the Simons Foundation, the Alfred P. Sloan Foundation Program in Public Understanding of Science and Technology, and Dalio Philanthropies._
####  _This program takes place within artist Ra√∫l de Nieves‚Äôs site-specific installation,_ In Light of Innocence _. Learn more about the exhibition[here](https://pioneerworks.org/exhibitions/raul-de-nieves-in-light-of-innocence)._

# Pino Palladino & Blake Mills featuring Sam Gendel & Chris Dave
## Second Set Added!
Friday, Oct 3, 2025
  

**Time**
7p & 9:30p
1st Set: Doors at 6, Show at 7
2nd Set: Doors at 8:30p, Show at 9:30p
**PLEASE NOTE:** Tickets within sections (seated and standing room) are General Admission and first come first serve. 
[7PM | SOLD OUT](https://www.eventbrite.com/e/1469916392499?aff=oddtdtcreator)[9:30PM | Buy Tickets](https://www.eventbrite.com/e/1470717498629?aff=oddtdtcreator)
Pioneer Works is thrilled to team up with Boom Collective to present 2 sets (7 PM & 9:30 PM) by **Pino Palladino & Blake Mills featuring Sam Gendel & Chris Dave** to the Main Hall on October 3, 2025. Grammy-winning musicians and producers Pino Palladino & Blake Mills reunite on the heels of their album-length, instrumental collaboration, _Notes With Attachments._
Featuring drummer Chris Dave (D‚ÄôAngelo, Anderson .Paak) and saxophonist Sam Gendel (Vampire Weekend, Maggie Rogers, and Perfume Genius), _Notes With Attachments_ presents
**Pino Palladino**  
A Grammy-winning bassist and producer, Pino Palladino has been a foundational figure in shaping the sound of modern soul, funk, and rock over the last four decades. Known for his groundbreaking fretless bass work on D‚ÄôAngelo‚Äôs _Voodoo_ and _Black Messiah_ , Palladino has recorded and toured with artists ranging from The Who and Paul Simon to Erykah Badu, Adele, and John Mayer. His melodic phrasing and rhythmic intuition have made him one of the most revered session musicians of our time.
**Blake Mills**  
Blake Mills is a Grammy-winning producer, guitarist, and songwriter whose adventurous solo work and collaborations have continually pushed the boundaries of modern music. From his early days with Simon Dawes to producing Alabama Shakes' _Sound & Color_ and creating immersive works like _Mutable Set_ and _Jelly Road_ , Mills blends technical precision with an experimental edge. His collaborations with Palladino‚Äîincluding 2021‚Äôs _Notes with Attachments_ ‚Äîreveal a deep musical rapport rooted in curiosity and range.
**Sam Gendel**  
A fixture of LA‚Äôs experimental scene, Sam Gendel is a composer, producer, and saxophonist known for his abstract, genre-blurring approach to jazz and ambient music. His extensive discography includes acclaimed solo work and collaborations with the likes of Louis Cole, Sam Wilkes, Antonia Cytrynowicz, and Palladino & Mills. Gendel‚Äôs live performances feel like transmissions from another plane‚Äîunexpected, emotive, and deeply textural.
**Chris Dave**  
One of the most influential drummers of his generation, Chris Dave has redefined the language of rhythm through his work with Maxwell, Robert Glasper, D‚ÄôAngelo, Adele, and countless others. As the founder of the Drumhedz, Dave leads a constellation of players whose futuristic grooves blend funk, gospel, hip-hop, and jazz. Known for his time-bending syncopation and razor-sharp instincts, Dave brings an interstellar intensity to every stage he touches.
####  _This program takes place within artist Ra√∫l de Nieves‚Äôs site-specific installation,_ In Light of Innocence _. Learn more about the exhibition[here](https://pioneerworks.org/exhibitions/raul-de-nieves-in-light-of-innocence)._

# Tomorrow Comes the Harvest: Jeff Mills featuring Jean Phi Dary & Prabhu Edouard
Wednesday, Oct 8, 2025
  

**Time**
Doors: 7pm
Start: 8pm
**PW Member Presale** :  
Tuesday, July 22 at 2 PM ET  

**General On Sale:**  
Wednesday, July 23 at 10 AM ET
Co-presenter
[Public Records](https://pioneerworks.org/search/public-records)
[Buy Tickets](https://www.eventbrite.com/e/1474323042909?aff=oddtdtcreator)
Pioneer Works and Public Records are proud to present **Tomorrow Comes The Harvest** , a live performance and collaborative project between Detroit techno pioneer **Jeff Mills** ; keyboardist and producer **Jean Philippe Dary** ; and Indo-French tabla virtuoso **Prabhu Edouard.**
Channeling the spirit of radical collaboration and musical transcendence, **Tomorrow Comes The Harvest** was initiated by the late Afrobeats legend Tony Allen and Mills, and has become known since as a boundary-blurring vessel for spiritual elevation through rhythm, sound, and improvisation.
**About the Artists**
**Jeff Mills** has never wallowed in his DJ renown and has kept on performing outstanding work at the intersection of music, contemporary art, pop culture, design, and science fiction‚Äîall the while running his record label, Axis Records, since 1992. He conquered Detroit's early techno scene as The Wizard in the 1980s, as part of the collective Underground Resistance. Afterwards, in the 2000s, he became inspired by space and science fiction, and started merging his interests with other art forms. He decided to create a new soundtrack for Fritz Lang's _Metropolis_ , which brought him to many other cine-mix performances and movie soundtracks. As a fine artist, Mills has shown numerous performances and exhibitions in galleries and museums such as the CCCB of Barcelona; the Southbanke Center and the Barbican in London; the Cin√©math√®que Fran√ßaise and Pompidou Center in Paris; and the Art Fair Monte Carlo, Monaco.
**Jean Philippe Dary** is a keyboard player, singer, producer, arranger, and songwriter. Born in France with Guyanese roots, he‚Äôs worked with African singers like Papa Wemba, Tourƒó Kunda, Omar Pene, and Alpha Blondy. He also worked on other projects and musical styles such as jazz (Paco Sery, Greg Osby, Brice Wassy, Hopen Collective, Pino Daniele), reggae (Sly And Robbie), pop and electronic music (Phoenix, Troublemakers). During these last 20 years, he has spent most of his time working with friend Tony Allen. They have recorded eight albums with artists like Jeff Mills, Damon Albarn, TY and Ernest Ranglin. He is the third member of Tomorrow Comes the Harvest.
**Prabhu Edouard** is an Indo-French percussionist and composer. Regarded as one of the most versatile tabla players of his generation, Edouard is a worthy disciple of renowned tabla maestro Pandit Shankar Ghosh. His album _K√îLAM_ highlights his compositionally innovative and contemporary vision of Indian music. Not only a sought after performer, Edouard is also an experienced pedagogue sharing his talents during various percussion masterclasses and international music seminars.
**Tomorrow Comes The Harvest** is the cumulative effort of talented musicians and their shared visions of what makes the art form of music so special. The concept was initiated and brought to life by the late Afrobeats creator and Nigerian drummer Tony Allen and Detroit techno pioneer Jeff Mills. Each artist belongs to a long tradition of using music to reach higher levels of consciousness. Joined by veteran keyboardist Jean-Phi Dary, the trio toured internationally until the untimely passing of Tony Allen in 2020. By then, however, the foundation of the project had been firmly established and was ready to evolve. Mills has reconfigured the concept once more as a trio, inviting tabla virtuoso Prabhu Edouard to join the ensemble.
Tomorrow Comes The Harvest is about exploring the unknown‚Äîtranscending boundaries through the intersection of sound and rhythm, guided by an array of improvisational movements.
####  _This program takes place within artist Ra√∫l de Nieves‚Äôs site-specific installation,_ In Light of Innocence _. Learn more about the exhibition_  _[here](https://pioneerworks.org/exhibitions/raul-de-nieves-in-light-of-innocence)._

# YOB with Windhand
Wednesday, Oct 15, 2025
  

**Time**
Doors: 7pm
Start: 7:30pm
**PW Member Presale** :  
Thursday, July 17 at 12 PM ET  

**General On Sale:**  
Friday, July 18 at 10 AM ET
Co-presenter
[LPR Presents](https://pioneerworks.org/search/lpr-presents)
[Buy Tickets](https://www.eventbrite.com/e/yob-with-windhand-tickets-1492194677449?aff=oddtdtcreator)
LPR Presents and Pioneer Works invite you to an evening of immersive metal and rock transcendence in the Pioneer Works Main Hall with a rare stateside appearance by doom metal titans **YOB**. 
Celebrating 25 years of genre-defying sonic ritual, YOB bring their singular blend of meditative heaviness and cathartic release to Brooklyn for one night only, alongside the Virginia-formed doom metal band **Windhand.** Revered for their deeply communal live performances, YOB turns every set into a shared act of transformation.   

**About the Artist**
"Slow is fast," says Mike Scheidt, guitarist and vocalist of Oregon doom metal trio **YOB** ‚Äîa band whose immersive, slow-burning sound has evolved over 25 years into something truly transcendent. With bassist Aaron Rieseberg and drummer Dave French, YOB crafts massive, meditative compositions that explore the edges of human experience, blending pulverizing sludge with moments of luminous clarity.
Formed in the late ‚Äô90s, YOB emerged from the stoner doom lineage of Sleep and Black Sabbath, but quickly developed a signature style‚Äîpendulous riffs, skyward vocals, and deeply introspective lyrics influenced by Scheidt‚Äôs Buddhist and Advaita Vedanta spiritual practices. Their albums, from _Elaborations of Carbon_ (2002) to _Our Raw Heart_ (2018), reflect a steady deepening in both sound and self-inquiry.
After a hiatus in the mid-2000s, YOB returned with renewed intensity, building a devoted following through relentless touring and acclaimed records like _Atma_ and _Clearing the Path to Ascend_ (Rolling Stone‚Äôs 2014 Metal Album of the Year). Their live shows are legendary for their emotional weight and sonic gravity‚Äîspaces of collective release where, as Scheidt puts it, ‚Äúthe crowd and the band are not two things.‚Äù
YOB continues to evolve, with compositions that stretch across time and feeling, forged by a trio of musicians attuned to each other‚Äôs deepest intuitions. Their music doesn‚Äôt offer easy answers‚Äîbut in its searching, it opens a space for presence, healing, and transformation. As Scheidt says, ‚ÄúOur music is medicine for us. If it‚Äôs that for anyone else, it‚Äôs an immense honor.‚Äù
####  _This program takes place within artist Ra√∫l de Nieves‚Äôs site-specific installation,_ In Light of Innocence _. Learn more about the exhibition_  _[here](https://pioneerworks.org/exhibitions/raul-de-nieves-in-light-of-innocence)._

# Ragas Live Festival 2025
## 24 hours of transcendent music
OCT 18‚Äì19, 2025
**TIME**
Doors: 6PM
Start: 7PM
End: 7pm
**ARTISTS**
To be announced
**FOOD & DRINK**
Yerba Madre
More to be announced  

[Buy Tickets](https://www.eventbrite.com/e/1527154142149?aff=oddtdtcreator)
‚Äú24 hours of uninterrupted, absolutely incredible music performances" ‚Äî[ _The New York Times_](https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2021/03/11/magazine/jason-mantzoukas-music.html)  
  
Pioneer Works is excited to present the 14th annual [Ragas Live Festival](http://www.ragaslive.com/) featuring 24 hours of transcendent music in the Pioneer Works Main Hall. The entire program will be broadcast live on video at [Pioneer Works' YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZNBLMJJp360) & [WKCR 89.9 FM in NYC](https://www.cc-seas.columbia.edu/wkcr/) (audio only).
For the 2025 festival, legendary maestros of the South Asian classical tradition will perform alongside groundbreaking contemporary artists in a musical journey through day and night. The artist lineup, which includes ecstatic Qawwali musicians, Grammy-winning classical maestros, and ambient projects, will be announced on September 3rd.
**About Ragas Live Festival**
Ragas Live Festival was born as an in-studio radio broadcast at Columbia University's radio station, WKCR, in 2012 and immediately gained a global listening audience. The annual presentation of 50-70 musicians, and its expansive presentation of music inspired by the Indian classical tradition, became central to a musical movement that The New York Times, The New Yorker, NPR, and others have called ‚ÄúThe Raga Renaissance.‚Äù The event first left the studio and became a live, in-person broadcast in 2016 at Pioneer Works, where it has since grown a passionate following.
The event is inspired by raga, the classical music tradition from South Asia, where specific modes harmonize with the moods and energy of particular times of day, such as sunrise, sunset, or the darkest hours of the night. Master musicians from the raga tradition are presented alongside legends in ambient music, minimalism, jazz, and global traditions.
#### _Ragas Live Festival is produced by Pioneer Works in collaboration with the Society for Arts and Culture of South Asia (Palo Alto), NYC Radio Live, People of Rhythm Productions, and Brooklyn Raga Massive. Ragas Live Festival is sponsored, in part, by the Greater New York Arts Development Fund of the New York City Department of Cultural Affairs, administered by Brooklyn Arts Council. Beverage sponsorship provided by Yerba Madre, as well as the New York State Council on the Arts with the support of the Office of the Governor and the New York State Legislature._
####  _This program takes place within artist Ra√∫l de Nieves‚Äôs site-specific installation,_ In Light of Innocence _. Learn more about the exhibition[here](https://pioneerworks.org/exhibitions/raul-de-nieves-in-light-of-innocence)._

6:30‚Äì9:30pm

RSVP

The Pioneer Works Residency Program provides emerging artists and musicians with a space to work, tools to create, and a platform to exchange ideas. During their time at Pioneer Works, residents have the opportunity to expand their practice and continue ongoing projects‚Äîworking side by side with educators and other creators across disciplines.
We hope you‚Äôll join us on Tuesday, October 28, for a members-only evening of studio tours from the Fall 2025 Residency cohort at Pioneer Works. Residents will walk attendees through their current projects while illuminating the creative process behind them.
A wine reception beginning at 6:30 pm will precede the tours.

# Andy Stott, Carrier 
## Durations 2025
Thursday, Nov 6, 2025
  

**Time**
Doors: 7pm
Start: 8pm
Artist
[Andy Stott](https://pioneerworks.org/programs/andy-stott-carrier)
Co-presenter
[Public Records](https://pioneerworks.org/search/public-records)
Get Tickets
[Buy Festival Passes](https://link.dice.fm/sdf012eac7ef)
Presented by Public Records in collaboration with Pioneer Works, Durations is a festival exploring the limits of sound across electronic, experimental performances and philosophical presentations. Pioneer Works joins 2025‚Äôs festival, presenting two leaders in the experimental world: **Andy Stott** and **Carrier**(live).
**Andy Stott‚Äôs** works, from the haunted ‚ÄúLuxury Problems‚Äù to 2021‚Äôs bruised, yet beautiful ‚ÄúNever the Right Time", fuse eerie textures, brutal rhythms, and ghostly vocals. Opening, **Carrier** is a boundary-pushing artist known for his evolution across drum & bass, techno, and experimental music.
Tickets on sale now. For more information and festival passes visit [durations.world](https://pioneerworks.org/programs/durations.world).
**About the artists**  
**Andy Stott** is a Manchester producer who‚Äôs carved out a dark, raw lane between techno, post-punk, and dream pop. Early dub techno gave way to 2011‚Äôs Passed Me By and We Stay Together‚Äîgrinding, broken-down epics dubbed "knackered house." His albums, from the haunted Luxury Problems to 2021‚Äôs bruised yet beautiful Never the Right Time, fuse eerie textures, brutal rhythms, and Alison Skidmore‚Äôs ghostly vocals. A key figure on Modern Love, Stott also works under aliases like Andrea and in brutalist projects like Millie & Andrea. His sound is murky, visceral, and completely his own.
**Carrier** is the latest project from Guy Brewer, a boundary-pushing artist known for his evolution across drum & bass, techno, and experimental music. Rising to fame in the '90s, he later launched the influential Shifted project and Avian label. With Carrier, Brewer departs from genre constraints, blending decades of sonic exploration into a unified, eclectic sound that reflects his journey and artistic reinvention.
**About the festival**
**Durations** is a weekend-long, multi-instrumental exploration of sound, asking how music connects body, mind, memory, and imagination across time. Presented by Public Records in collaboration with Pioneer Works, the festival brings together a diasporic lineup of electronic and experimental artists and guest speakers for a series of live and club performances and presentations that push boundaries in music, philosophy, and design theory. The 2025 lineup includes a performance from **Andy Stott** onsite in PW's Main Hall, and features artists **Actress** , **Call Super** , **Lyra Pramuk,** **MARR√òN** , **Suso S√°iz** , **Tornado Wallace** , and **Vlada**.

# Chokehole 
## Halftime Show by Hairbone
Nov 11 ‚Äì 12
  

**Time**
Doors: 7pm
Start: 8pm
Two Nights of Drag, Wrestling, and Chaos
[Get Tickets for 11/11](https://www.eventbrite.com/e/1633040671609?aff=oddtdtcreator)[Get Tickets for 11/12](https://www.eventbrite.com/e/1633051895179?aff=oddtdtcreator)
CWith economies crashing, techno fascism uploading, and the nuclear war boiling, what better way to celebrate the end of the world than drag queen wrestling?
Pioneer Works is excited to present **Chokehole‚Äôs** newest drag spectacular, _ARMAGEDDON_. A hilarious take on current events, the performance features Chokehole‚Äôs divas taking center stage‚Äîto throw, flip, and fling each other across the ring and into your hardened hearts. With acrobatics and custom backstage videos,_ARMAGEDDON_ features Ra√∫l de Nieves‚Äôs band **Hairbone** performing a live, halftime show within the artist‚Äôs Main Hall exhibition, _In Light of Innocence_. This smackdown is not to be missed!
**About the Artists**
**Chokehole** is a drag wrestling event born out of New Orleans‚Äôs underground queer party scene. Since 2018, Chokehole has been merging the camp aesthetics and culture of drag with the physicality of WWE-style wrestling. Chokehole is known for its humorous take on contemporary politics, its irreverent violence, and proof that gays not only bash back, they backflip. Chokehole has graced and stained the stages of Area 15 (Las Vegas), Kampnagel (Hamburg), Times Square Arts, the Metropolitan Museum of Art, and MoMA PS1, to humbly brag and name a few.
![Hairbone](https://cdn.sanity.io/images/vgvol637/production/2a658938a833fb44cf73904ce345d50c9b258cc7-2634x1606.jpg?w=1000)
Hairbone Courtesy the artists
**Hairbone** is a New York-based power trio composed of artists Ra√∫l de Nieves, Jessie Stead, and Nathan Whipple, formerly known as Haribo. Functioning mainly in the art world, Hairbone has inflicted their carnivalesque live shows upon audiences in museums to decrepit basements for nearly a decade. Each unique, narrative multimedia performance features frontman de Nieves inhabiting new personae in a sculptural actionist mode. Brandishing oversized, text-emblazoned props as if they were picket signs, de Nieves proceeds to destroy them as Hairbone‚Äôs near-opera burlesque freak show unfurls. Obliquely political, theirs is a protest music without didacticism.
####  _This program takes place within artist Ra√∫l de Nieves‚Äôs site-specific installation,_ In Light of Innocence _. Learn more about the exhibition[here](https://pioneerworks.org/exhibitions/raul-de-nieves-in-light-of-innocence)._

# The American Analog Set perform ‚ÄúMagic Hour‚Äù
Thursday, Nov 20, 2025
  

**Time**
Doors: 7pm
Start: 8pm
**PW Member Presale** :  
Thursday, July 17 at 12 PM ET  

**General On Sale:**  
Friday, July 18 at 10 AM ET
[Buy Tickets](https://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-american-analog-set-tickets-1474915555129)
Pioneer Works is proud to present the **American Analog Set** for the Brooklyn debut of _Magic Hour_ , a special seated performance in our Main Hall. An intimate, immersive live show, _Magic Hour_ features thoughtfully selected songs from the band‚Äôs first six albums: _The Fun Of Watching Fireworks_ , _From Our Living Room To Yours_ , _The Golden Band_ , _Know By Heart_ , _Promise Of Love_ , and _Set Free_. It‚Äôs also the band‚Äôs first proper show in nearly 20 years.
First conceived in their hometown of Austin, Magic Hour features original members Andrew Kenny (guitar, vocals), Jesse Lee (bass), Tom Hoff (keys, guitar), Sean Ripple (vibes, vocals), and special guest Matthew Frank (drums, percussion). The show is presented in a fully seated, theatrical environment enhanced by immersive lighting and set design by Lisa Laratta (Paper Chairs). More than a carefully staged retrospective of the American Analog Set‚Äôs early discography, it‚Äôs something quieter, more intimate: a sonic memory book of the slowcore, post-rock, and lo-fi lullabies that defined a cult corner of American indie music from the late ‚Äô90s through the mid-2000s.
**About the Artist**
Formed in Austin in the mid-90s, the **American Analog Set** quietly became cult legends of American indie music with their distinctive blend of analog warmth, ambient textures, and minimalist pop restraint. Over six albums between 1996 and 2005, the band developed a sound that drew from German kosmische, ‚Äò90s slowcore, and home-recorded psychedelia‚Äîalways intimate, often hypnotic, and never in a rush.
####  _This program takes place within artist Ra√∫l de Nieves‚Äôs site-specific installation,_ In Light of Innocence _. Learn more about the exhibition_  _[here](https://pioneerworks.org/exhibitions/raul-de-nieves-in-light-of-innocence)._

# DakhaBrakha
Sunday, Mar 1, 2026
  

**Time**
Doors: 7pm
Start: 8pm
**PW Member Presale** :  
Tuesday, July 8 at 10:00 am   

**General On Sale:**  
Wednesday, July 9 at 12:00 pm
Co-presenter
[World Music Institute](https://pioneerworks.org/search/world-music-institute)
[Buy Tickets](https://www.eventbrite.com/e/dakhabrahka-tickets-1458480627819)
In partnership with World Music Institute, Pioneer Works is proud to present the renowned Ukrainian quartet **DakhaBrakha** in the Main Hall on March 1, 2026. Rooted in traditional polyphonic folk and layered with global influences, DakhaBrakha's spellbinding sound has captivated audiences around the world.
**DakhaBrakha** is a music quartet comprised by musicians Marko Halanevych, Iryna Kovalenko, Olena Tsybulska, and Nina Garenetska from Kyiv, Ukraine. Their self-proclaimed ‚Äúethno chaos‚Äù sound spans years of performances prior to Russia‚Äôs 2022 invasion, but war is in everything now. They masterfully blend Ukrainian traditional music with influences from around the world, resulting in an unexpected new sound.
They are troubadours, activists and educators. Though their name means Give/Take in the old language, DakhaBrakha is new Ukraine, both pre-colonial and post-Soviet, working within a global network of art and music. They aim to help audiences see Ukraine not as a monolith, but as a cosmopolitan culture that takes in other cultures, and gives in return.

Since 2013, Pioneer Works has hosted Second Sundays, a free monthly open house. Highlighting our programs, artists-in-residence, and Red Hook community members, Second Sundays features open studios, exhibitions, workshops, live music, and food‚Äîwith programming across all three floors and in our garden. 
Food and drink by Pioneer Works Bar.
_Pioneer Works is supported in part by public funds from the New York City Department of Cultural Affairs in Partnership with the City Council and the New York State Council on the Arts with the support of the Office of the Governor and the New York State Legislature._
# On View
#### [Daniel Johnston: I Think, I Draw, I Am](https://pioneerworks.org/exhibitions/daniel-johnston-i-think-i-draw-i-am)
#### [Felix Rodriguez: Legendary Looks](https://pioneerworks.org/exhibitions/felix-rodriguez-legendary-looks-my-ballroom-story)
# Open Studios
Meet current artists-in-residence in our Visual Art & Music Residency during open studios.
  

[Matt Bruinooge](https://pioneerworks.org/residency/matt-bruinooge)[Peggy Chiang](https://pioneerworks.org/residency/peggy-chiang)[Biraaj Dodiya](https://pioneerworks.org/residency/biraaj-dodiya)[Cameron Granger](https://pioneerworks.org/residency/cameron-granger)[Tommy Kha](https://pioneerworks.org/residency/tommy-kha)[Alison Nguyen](https://pioneerworks.org/residency/alison-nguyen)[Samora Pinderhughes](https://pioneerworks.org/residency/samora-pinderhughes)[Leah Victoria](https://pioneerworks.org/residency/leah-victoria)
# Schedule
Title
Time
#### Exhibition Scavenger Hunt
12-6 pm
Location: 3rd Floor Gallery
Grab a scavenger hunt sheet from the North Hall and enjoy an in-depth exploration of Felix Rodriguez's exhibition. Once you‚Äôve completed the hunt, return your sheet and claim your prize!
#### Fan Decorating
12-4 pm
Location: Classroom
Decorate and design your very own handheld fan and get in the Ballroom spirit! Later, bring your fresh fan to Legendary Looks Mini-Ball. Clack your fan and cheer on the competitors as they walk the runway.
#### Meet the Oysters with Billion Oyster Project
12-4 pm
Location: Garden
Get a firsthand look at our locally grown oysters from Red Hook‚Äôs waters and chat with experts from Billion Oyster Project about how these amazing creatures help restore New York Harbor.
#### Bioplastic Creations with Genspace
12:30pm - 3:30pm
Location: Conference Room
Explore the creative potential of bioplastics‚Äîcolorful, moldable materials made from renewable resources like cornstarch, gelatin, and food waste. Genspace, the community biology lab based in Sunset Park, Brooklyn, invites us to experiment with a variety of pre-made bioplastics and transform them into unique accessories and everyday objects. Crafting examples and recipes will be on hand to spark ideas. All materials provided while supplies last. No experience necessary. Open to all ages.
#### Voguing Workshops ft. Icon Pony Zion
1-2 pm
Location: Main Hall
Learn how to vogue‚Äîa highly stylized dance that evolved out of Harlem‚Äôs ballroom scene of the 1960s, which riffs on fashion editorial poses‚Äîwith Icon Pony Zion. Inspired by Felix Rodriguez‚Äôs exhibition _Legendary Looks: My Ballroom Story_ , the workshop is open to participants of all ages.
#### Job Hunting Confessional Booth
1-4 PM
Location: Media Lab
OR Books and Words of Mouth (WoM) are making an audio piece about job hunting and want to hear from you. Meet WoM founder Rachel Meade Smith in the Media Lab to record a quick story about your own search for work, and learn more about Smith‚Äôs forthcoming anthology, published by OR Books, on looking for work. 
#### Solar Gazing with the Amateur Astronomers
1‚Äì4 pm
Location: Garden
Join the Amateur Astronomers Association of New York in the PW garden for safe solar viewing. Telescopes will be provided between 1:00 and 4:00 pm. _Weather permitting_.
#### Open Studios
2-4 pm
Location: Music Studio, 2nd Floor Studios, 3rd Floor Studios
Learn more about the practices of our artists-in-residence during open studio hours.
  

#### Hot Physics
2:30-4PM
Location: Science Studios
Join Astronomy on Tap in the Science Studios for some Hot Physics this summer! We will have two speakers, Daniel Burgess (Columbia) and Andrea Bracamonte (CUNY), talking about plasma waves and solar flares. Cool off with Astronomy on Tap this summer and enjoy talks about some of the hottest phenomena in the Universe (hottest in temperature and every other definition of the word!) along with some fun games and trivia. This sizzling theme was chosen as a lead-up to Pioneer Works‚Äô forthcoming Heat Week, which will take place during Climate Week NYC.
#### Legendary Looks Mini-Ball
4-7 pm
Location: Main Hall
As a culminating moment for Felix Rodriguez‚Äôs exhibition _Legendary Looks: My Ballroom Story_ and celebratory event that precedes NYC Black Pride, Pioneer Works is pleased to present a ball organized by curator Michael Roberson. Featuring a live DJ set by Byrell The Great and commentating by Legendary Precious Basquiat, the mini-ball will be separated into categories and judged by a panel to be announced.

# Bonnie "Prince" Billy, Tashi Dorji
Friday, Aug 8, 2025
  

**Time**
Doors: 7pm
Start: 8pm
past
Co-presenter
[The Bowery Presents](https://pioneerworks.org/search/the-bowery)
[Past Event](https://www.eventbrite.com/e/bonnie-prince-billy-tickets-1265908138319)
Pioneer Works is excited to team up with [Bowery Presents](https://www.bowerypresents.com/) to bring the legendary Kentuckian songwriter Bonnie "Prince" Billy to our Main Hall stage this August 8, 2025 with support from Bhutanese guitarist, Tashi Dorji. 
**About the artists**
**Bonnie "Prince" Billy**
The human who sings and composes under the name **Bonnie "Prince" Billy** and acts under the name Will Oldham has, over the past three-plus decades, made an idiosyncratic journey through, and an indelible mark on, the worlds of independent music and cinema. With his highly individualistic approach to music making and the music industry, one that cherishes intimacy, community, mystery, and spontaneity; his brilliance has captivated fans and made Bonny one of our most influential and beloved songsmiths.
Bonnie "Prince" Billy's latest offerings include 2023‚Äôs _Keeping Secrets Will Destroy You_ and 2024‚Äôs _Hear the Children Sing the Evidence_(with Nathan Salsburg and Tyler Trotter). He had a cameo role in Jeff Nichols‚Äô _The Bikeriders_. BPB‚Äôs newest record is _The Purple Bird_(produced by David Ferguson), and features such giants of American music as John Anderson and Tim O‚ÄôBrien.
  
**Tashi Dorji** is a Bhutanese guitarist and improvisational musician known for his avant-garde and experimental approach to music. Tashi‚Äôs own skewering of guitar traditions has developed an idiosyncratic take on the instrument, one defined by movement and profound openness to technique.

# The Woods by San Fermin & BalletCollective
## Created by Ellis Ludwig-Leone and Troy Schumacher
Thursday, July 31 ‚Äì Saturday, August 2, 2025
past
**Time  
** Doors: 7pm  
Start: 8pm
[Past Event](https://www.eventbrite.com/e/1371320900729)[Past Event](https://www.eventbrite.com/e/1371567036929)[Past Event](https://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-woods-by-san-fermin-balletcollective-night-3-tickets-1511199190459?aff=oddtdtcreator)
Join us for 3 nights of amazing performances from July 31st to August 2nd for **_The Woods_** , an immersive concert experience created by composer **Ellis Ludwig-Leone** of the Brooklyn-based band **San Fermin** and choreographer and director **Troy Schumacher** of **BalletCollective**. With two performances scheduled over back-to-back evenings in the Main Hall, _The Woods_ celebrates the alchemical power of music and dance to transform fear and loss into life-affirming moments of community.
_The Woods_ is Ludwig-Leone and Schumacher‚Äôs newest and perhaps most ambitious collaboration yet: exploding the rich musical universe of San Fermin‚Äôs catalogue across an enveloping set designed by **Jason Ardizzone-West**(_Redwood_ , The Weeknd, Dua Lipa). The set is visually inspired by an original sculpture by Ardizzone-West: a fractured frame with a snow white surface, belying something blood red and alive beneath. Featuring a cast of 17 dancers and singers moving freely across multiple stages and amongst the audience, the set becomes a living, breathing entity, while the band, situated throughout the space, puts the audience inside the music-making. Costumes by CFDA Award-winning fashion designer Elena Velez conjure a mythic dreamscape where fantasy and reality blur over the course of the 75 minute show. 
In this production, the woods become a gathering place for searching souls awaiting a chance for change. Held together by this fragile connection, everyone who enters sees their own desires and fears written across the enchanted space, and as the sun sets, they are drawn deeper into a magical and sometimes perilous world.
The music of San Fermin, lauded for its ‚Äúknack for simultaneously expressing beauty and crisis,‚Äù lends itself to this expansive setting and theatrical treatment. What is the role of storytelling‚Äîand songwriting‚Äîin a constantly shifting, often terrifying reality? _The Woods_ celebrates the alchemical power of music and dance to transform fear and loss into life-affirming and communal experiences: in a world that is always in motion, we must resolve to love.
In this spirit, _The Woods_ is meant to be undertaken in a crowd. Drawing on elements of a live rock concert, theater, and contemporary dance, _The Woods_ promises to be a singular and unforgettable event.  
  
**CREATIVE TEAM**
**Troy Schumacher,** Co-Creator, Director & Choreographer  
**Ellis Ludwig-Leone** , Co-Creator, Composer & Music Director  
**Jason Ardizzone-West,** Stage Designer & Source Artist

**Marzia Memoli** , Rehearsal Director   
**Lorenzo Pagano** , Rehearsal Director  
**Philip Nix** ,  
**Meyrem Bulucek** , Campaign Photographer  
  
**SAN FERMIN**

**FEATURED PERFORMERS**

The creation of _The Woods _was made possible, in part, through a leadership gift from Stephen Kroll Reidy._

# Rachel Kushner: Creation Lake
## Author Talks
Sunday, Jul 13, 2025
1‚Äì2pm
past
This program is part of July Second Sundays
[Past Event](https://www.eventbrite.com/e/1323581189969?aff=oddtdtcreator)
Donate
Pioneer Works presents the official paperback launch of**Rachel Kushner** ‚Äôs **_Creation Lake_** , one of the most talked-about books of the year and a finalist for the Booker Prize.
_Creation Lake_ is a novel about a secret agent, a thirty-four-year-old American woman of ruthless tactics and clean beauty, who is sent to do dirty work in France. ‚ÄúSadie Smith‚Äù is how the narrator introduces herself to the rural commune of French subversives on whom she is keeping tabs, and to her lover, Lucien, a young and well-born Parisian she has met by ‚Äúcold bump‚Äù‚Äîmaking him believe the encounter was accidental. In this region of old farms and prehistoric caves, Sadie becomes entranced by a mysterious figure named Bruno Lacombe, a mentor to the young activists who believes that the path to emancipation is not revolt but a return to the ancient past. Sadie is certain she‚Äôs the seductress and puppet master of those she surveils. But Bruno is seducing her with his ingenious counter-histories, his artful laments, his own tragic story.
Rachel Kushner has become one of our most iconic and influential contemporary writers: her cherished novels on art and motorcycles, politics and prisons, have traveled from Cuba to California to Red Guards-era Italy to the ancient caves and anarchist collectives of _Creation Lake_ ‚Äîa noir fiction that‚Äôs taut, dazzling, and replete with high comedy and high art alike.
For this special Author Talk during Second Sundays, Kushner will be in conversation with PW‚Äôs Director of Publishing, Joshua Jelly-Schapiro. Books will be available for sale, and a signing with the writer will follow her talk.
**Rachel Kushner** is the author of the _New York Times_ bestseller _Creation Lake_ , her latest novel; _The Hard Crowd_ , her acclaimed essay collection; and the internationally bestselling novels _The Mars Room_ , _The Flamethrowers_ , and _Telex from Cuba_ , as well as a book of short stories, _The Strange Case of Rachel K_. She has won the Prix M√©dicis and been a finalist for the National Book Critics Circle Award, the Folio Prize, and was twice a finalist for the Booker Prize and the National Book Award in Fiction. _Creation Lake_ was also longlisted for the National Book Award. She is a Guggenheim Foundation Fellow and the recipient of the Harold D. Vursell Memorial Award from the American Academy of Arts and Letters. Her books have been translated into twenty-seven languages.
**Joshua Jelly-Schapiro** is Director of Publishing at Pioneer Works and the Co-Editor-in-Chief of Pioneer Works _Broadcast_. A geographer and writer, he teaches at NYU and writes for _The New York Review of Books_ , _The New Yorker,_ and _The New York Times_ , among many other publications. His books include _Island People_ , _Names of New York_ , and, with Rebecca Solnit, _Nonstop Metropolis: A New York City Atlas_.
#### This program is part of Pioneer Works Broadcast's Author Talks, a series highlighting authors and thinkers across disciplines. 
#### Pioneer Works Broadcast is supported by the Alfred P. Sloan Foundation Program in Public Understanding of Science and Technology, bridging the two cultures of science and the arts.

Since 2013, Pioneer Works has hosted Second Sundays, a free monthly open house. Highlighting our programs, artists-in-residence, and Red Hook community members, Second Sundays features open studios, exhibitions, workshops, live music, and food‚Äîwith programming across all three floors and in our garden. 
Food and drink by Nathanael Cox & [Prima Brooklyn](https://www.primabrooklyn.com/), and Pioneer Works Bar. Handmade natural Mexican ice cream & sweets by [La Newyorkina](https://www.lanewyorkina.com/). 
_Pioneer Works is supported in part by public funds from the New York City Department of Cultural Affairs in Partnership with the City Council and the New York State Council on the Arts with the support of the Office of the Governor and the New York State Legislature._
# On View
#### [Felix Rodriguez: Legendary Looks](https://pioneerworks.org/exhibitions/felix-rodriguez-legendary-looks-my-ballroom-story)
#### [Daniel Johnston: I Think, I Draw, I Am](https://pioneerworks.org/exhibitions/daniel-johnston-i-think-i-draw-i-am)
# Open Studios
Meet current artists-in-residence in our Visual Art & Music Residency during open studios. 
[Matt Bruinooge](https://pioneerworks.org/residency/matt-bruinooge)[Peggy Chiang](https://pioneerworks.org/residency/peggy-chiang)[Biraaj Dodiya](https://pioneerworks.org/residency/biraaj-dodiya)[Henry Fraser](https://pioneerworks.org/residency/henry-fraser)[Cameron Granger](https://pioneerworks.org/residency/cameron-granger)[Alison Nguyen](https://pioneerworks.org/residency/alison-nguyen)[Samora Pinderhughes](https://pioneerworks.org/residency/samora-pinderhughes)[Kara Springer](https://pioneerworks.org/residency/kara-springer)
# Schedule
Title
Time
#### MSCHF: King Solomon‚Äôs Baby
12-6 PM
Location: Main Hall
MSCHF is a Brooklyn-based conceptual collective developing elaborate interventions that expose and leverage the absurdity of our cultural, political, and monetary systems. MSCHF provokes widespread public response as a means of performance, directly within the environments it critiques. Inspired by The Judgement of Solomon‚Äîa biblical story in which Solomon rules that a baby be cut in half, after two women both claimed to be its mother‚Äî _King Solomon‚Äôs Baby_ comprises a large-scale, sculptural baby that will be sliced and sold to online bidders over the course of three days.
#### Exhibition Scavenger Hunt
12‚Äì6 pm
Location: 2nd Floor Gallery, 3rd Floor Gallery
Grab a scavenger hunt sheet from the North Hall and enjoy an in depth exploration of the latest Pioneer Works exhibitions by Felix Rodriguez and Daniel Johnston. Once you‚Äôve completed the hunt, return your sheet and claim your prize!
#### Unconventional Comic Club with Umber Majeed
12-4 pm
Location: Classroom
Inspired by Daniel Johnston‚Äôs illustrations, we invite you to create a page for our community comic book.
#### Rachel Kushner In Conversation: Creation Lake 
1-2 pm
Location: Main Hall
Pioneer Works presents the official paperback launch of Rachel Kushner‚Äôs _Creation Lake_ , one of the most talked-about books of the year and a finalist for the Booker Prize.  

  
For this special Author Talk during Second Sundays, Kushner will be in conversation with Pioneer Works Director of Publishing, Joshua Jelly-Schapiro. Books will be available for sale, and a signing with the writer will follow her talk.
#### Solar Gazing with the Amateur Astronomers
1-4 pm
Location: Garden
Join the Amateur Astronomers Association of New York in the Pioneer Works garden for safe solar viewing. Telescopes will be provided. _Weather permitting._
#### Close up on the World of Fungi with the New York Mycological Society
1-4 PM
Location: Garden
Get a close up on the fascinating and astonishingly beautiful world of fungi at the ID table led by experts from the New York Mycological Society. Learn the basics of mushroom identification and fungal microscopy. Handlenses and a microscope will be provided. Beginners and all ages welcome. Feel free to bring your own fungal specimens for closer study.
#### Screening: Birdbrain
1-4 pm
Location: Science Studios
Revisit a captivating conversation from our _Scientific Controversies_ series exploring the complexities of avian intelligence. Join Pioneer Works Director of Sciences, Janna Levin, in conversation with neuroscientists Erich Jarvis and Lauren Riters as they consider: Just how smart are birds? From vocal learning to flocking behavior, this discussion dives into what bird behavior can reveal about brains‚Äîboth theirs and ours.
#### Performance: a soft afternoon
2-3 pm
Location: Science Studios
Conceived by choreographer **Abigail Levine** , _a soft afternoon_ is an exchange of creative work, personal and critical reflections by poet **Kimberly Alidio** , composer **Seth Cluett** , performance artist **Asia Stewart** , and dancer and scholar **Kristopher KQ Pourzal**. Borrowing its format from a course once taught by Alvin Lucier, _a soft afternoon_ expands the vision of who the fabled experimental avant garde of New York was, what it did, and how it has been repurposed, re-politicized, reimagined, and remade. Conceived as a preamble to Levine‚Äôs forthcoming performance _Six Quiet Dogs_ , this program is supported by a grant from Brooklyn Arts Council. Photo of Kristopher KQ Pourzal. Photo by Scott Shaw.
#### Open Studios
2-4 pm
Location: Music Studio, 2nd Floor Studios, 3rd Floor Studios
Learn more about the practices of our artists-in-residence during open studio hours.
  

#### Eco-Exploration Walk with the New York Mycological Society
3-4 PM
Location: Garden
Discover the fungi and flora hiding in plain sight in our everyday urban spaces. Join us for a mini-foray into the garden and surrounding neighborhood, led by New York Mycological Society members and amateur mycologists **Wilton Rao, Victoria Bayevskiy, Maya Han, and Misha Zitser**. In the event of inclement weather, we will move indoors for a fun and informative mycology lecture in the science studios on the third floor. Magnifying hand lenses will be provided. No experience is required and all ages are welcome. [RSVP here.](https://forms.gle/inX3158BnuwxDvrz9)
#### Ragini Festival and Rasa Present: Camila Celin, Roshni Samlal, and Mehrnam Rastegari
4-5 pm
Location: Main Hall
Three female virtuosos‚ÄîNYC-based Colombian sarodist **Camila Celin** , Trinidadian-born and New York-based tabla player **Roshni Samlal** , and Iranian composer and kamancheh player **Mehrnam Rastegari** ‚Äî bring together the ancient sounds of India, Iran, and the Indo-Caribbean through a fresh, urban Brooklyn lens. Their two-set performance blends deep classical traditions with contemporary spirit‚Äîfusing North Indian ragas, Persian improvisation, and diasporic rhythms.
#### Ragini Festival and Rasa Present: DJ Raat Ki Rani
5-6 pm
Location: Main Hall
RƒÅginƒ´ Festival curator and producer Roshni Samlal, aka **DJ Raat Ki Rani** , spins an hour-long set inspired by her Indo-Caribbean heritage and upbringing in the 90s. Expecting to hear the sounds of the Asian underground, global club, soca, and chutney.

![Sliced baby](https://cdn.sanity.io/images/vgvol637/production/918c5bbae946a407ad3a5e1bb41c3fcb3fa4c0c5-8688x5792.jpg?w=2000)

# MSCHF: King Solomon's Baby
THURSDAY, JULY 10 - SUNDAY, JULY 13, 2025
past
Artist
[MSCHF](https://pioneerworks.org/programs/mschf-king-solomon-s-baby)
With _King Solomon‚Äôs Baby_(2025), MSCHF literally hack their way through a famous parable, reimagining the moment made iconic by countless Renaissance depictions: King Solomon‚Äôs decree to split a baby in half to settle a dispute between two women claiming to be the mother. When one pleads to rescind her claim in order to save the child, Solomon identifies her as the true mother and awards her custody, recognizing her selflessness.
In MSCHF‚Äôs version, they are the court jester, turning a solemn tale into a spectacle. MSCHF will stage a 15-foot-long sculpture, carved to resemble a larger-than-life baby. Fractions of this work will be sold to online buyers, after which the collective will use a hot wire jig to slice the baby apart. The more buyers, the more elaborate the performance: a two-day-long event in which the room-sized baby is cut into anywhere between 2 and 1000 slices. This process will be livestreamed on MSCHF‚Äôs website, and will culminate in a viewing of the fully deconstructed sculpture during Second Sundays on July 13.
**About the Artist**
MSCHF is a Brooklyn-based conceptual collective developing elaborate interventions that expose and leverage the absurdity of our cultural, political, and monetary systems. MSCHF provokes widespread public response as a means of performance, directly within the environments it critiques. Ultimately, the collective itself represents an intricate subversion of corporate structure, that seeks to challenge every sphere with which it comes into contact.

# Opening Reception for MSCHF: King Solomon's Baby
Thursday, Jul 10, 2025
7‚Äì9pm
past
Artist
[MSCHF](https://pioneerworks.org/programs/opening-reception-for-mschf-king-solomon-s-baby)
[Past Event](https://www.eventbrite.com/e/1438415993959)
Join Pioneer Works for a public opening celebration of MSCHF: _King Solomon‚Äôs Baby_.
With _King Solomon‚Äôs Baby_(2025), MSCHF literally hack their way through a famous parable, reimagining the moment made iconic by countless Renaissance depictions: King Solomon‚Äôs decree to split a baby in half to settle a dispute between two women claiming to be the mother. When one pleads to rescind her claim in order to save the child, Solomon identifies her as the true mother and awards her custody, recognizing her selflessness.
In MSCHF‚Äôs version, they are the court jester, turning a solemn tale into a spectacle. MSCHF will stage a 15-foot-long sculpture, carved to resemble a larger-than-life baby. Fractions of this work will be sold to online buyers, after which the collective will use a hot wire jig to slice the baby apart. The more buyers, the more elaborate the performance: a two-day-long event in which the room-sized baby is cut into anywhere between 2 and 1000 slices. This process will be livestreamed on MSCHF‚Äôs website, and will culminate in a viewing of the fully deconstructed sculpture during Second Sundays on July 13.
**About the Artist**
MSCHF is a Brooklyn-based conceptual collective developing elaborate interventions that expose and leverage the absurdity of our cultural, political, and monetary systems. MSCHF provokes widespread public response as a means of performance, directly within the environments it critiques. Ultimately, the collective itself represents an intricate subversion of corporate structure, that seeks to challenge every sphere with which it comes into contact.
Be the first to hear about new programs, exhibitions, and updates from Pioneer Works.
SIGN UP
Or consider helping us build community through the arts and sciences by [making a tax-deductible donation here](https://pioneerworks.org/support).

# contemplations
## Contemplations is a celebration of National Sawdust's work from inception through the 6th season in 2020-21, and a tribute to all the artists, collaborators, funders, and friends who have made it possible. A special thanks to the National Sawdust board and team who collectively help us make our dreams into reality.
## This book features the photographic work of Jill Steinberg, with curation and story by Paola Prestini. It is a companion project to the television and video broadcast series of the same name developed in partnership with The WNET Group's ALL ARTS platforms featuring highlights of National Sawdust's work in the world.
## [Learn more about Contemplations here.](https://ci.ovationtix.com/36490/store/products/83395)

Artistic expression empowers us all to create a more just and joyful world.
Help us produce and curate transformative artistic collaborations through our digital stage and state-of-the-art venue in Brooklyn, NY.
In celebration of our current campaign Contemplations from National Sawdust, your gift will be matched dollar-for-dollar through June 30th.
[Donate today](https://nationalsawdust.org/support)

National Sawdust works with leading brands and partners to create world-class bespoke experiences and events presented in our venue, on our digital stage, and live-streamed.   

Whether a private concert, seated dinner and performance, conference, or reception; the National Sawdust team will work with you to create a memorable and impactful event that leverages our creative and musical expertise and our state-of-the-art venue technology featuring Meyer Sound‚Äôs Constellation system.

### National Sawdust & LVMH/Fresh skin care company
At National Sawdust, we believe that artistic expression empowers us all to create a more joyful and just world.National Sawdust‚Äôs mission is rooted in music discovery that is open, inclusive, and based in active mentorship of emerging artists, while building new audiences and communities of music devotees.National Sawdust engages artists in an ecosystem of incubation to dissemination, programming groundbreaking new music in our state-of-the-art Williamsburg venue, and developing and touring new, collaborative music-driven projects ‚Äî the National Sawdust DNA produces and presents world-class artistic work which embraces a wide stylistic approach to music.
National Sawdust believes in being an innovative leader in changing the landscape of contemporary music, by bringing all voices to the stage and beyond ‚Äî artistic representation that reflects the ever-evolving multicultural society in which we live.
‚ÄúAs a composer, I believe the role of an artist in the 21st century is that of creator, educator, activist, and entrepreneur. At National Sawdust, supporting emerging artists is our core mission, nurturing a wide array of voices who are collectively reshaping the landscape of new music for this new century. The work we champion and help support speaks to the National Sawdust DNA: empowering high-level artistry, regardless of genre, by multicultural artists who tell their stories through their music.‚Äù
‚Äì Paola Prestini, Composer, Co-Founder and Artistic Director

Just Mustard is **Katie Ball** , **David Noonan** , **Mete Kalyon** , **Rob Clarke** , and **Shane Maguire**. _Heart Under_ earned Just Mustard widespread acclaim, with the band racking up rave reviews from _NME_ ,_The Telegraph_ , _Pitchfork_ , _DIY_ , _The Independent_ , and plenty more. # The GRAMMY Museum presents A New York Evening With Yungblud
[](https://www.nationalsawdust.org/event/the-grammy-museum-presents-a-new-york-evening-with-yungblud#redesign)
[Performances](https://www.nationalsawdust.org/performances-prev)[HOME](https://www.nationalsawdust.org/event/the-grammy-museum-presents-a-new-york-evening-with-yungblud#home)[IDEAS](https://www.nationalsawdust.org/event/the-grammy-museum-presents-a-new-york-evening-with-yungblud)
The GRAMMY Museum is thrilled to welcome Yungblud to National Sawdust in Brooklyn, NY for a brief preview of his new documentary YUNGBLUD. ARE YOU READY, BOY, a discussion of his new album IDOLS, and a special live performance. 
LIVE AT NATIONAL SAWDUST // DOORS AT 6:30PM
September 15, 2025
7:30 pm
[BUY TICKETS](https://www.universe.com/events/a-new-york-evening-with-yungblud-tickets-FBJRHT)
